Step 1.reason: The disease mechanism is defined as loss of DJ-1 function leading to cell death under oxidative stress.

Step 2.reason: Cell death assay models neurotoxicity relevant to Parkinson's disease.

Sub-step 3a.reason: Basic controls and replicates are not explicitly mentioned in the Methods section.

Step 3b.reason: Cell death assays are widely accepted historical methods in neurotoxicology.

Sub-step 4a.reason: Statistical analyses or OddsPath values are not provided for this variant.

Sub-step 4b.reason: Less than 10 control variants used (only wild-type and L66P DJ-1 tested).
